data.title: Stem and Leaf Plot
data.solution:
import random


vals = []

raw = input()
rawS = raw.split(' ')
for rs in rawS:
 vals.append(int(rs))

vals.sort()

a = 0

for i in range(1,10):
 print(i,end='')
 print("|",end='')
 while a < len(vals) and (int)(vals[a]/10) == i:
  print(vals[a]%10,end='')
  a = a+1
 print("")
data.statement:
A Stem and Leaf plot is a type of table used to display a collection of data where every data point has the same number of digits.

Stem and leaf plots consists of two halves: a <<stem>>, and <<leaves>> sticking out from the stem.  

The stems consist of the first few (usually one) highest-significance digits of a number. 

The leaves extending from each stem represent the lowest significant digits for each data point in the collection. 

A leaf can be recombined with the stem it belongs to in order to get back the value that leaf represents.



For this challenge, the <<stem will represent the 1st digit of the data points (the tens place)>>, and the <<leaves will represent the 2nd digit of the data points (the ones place)>>.

A Stem and Leaf plot for the values <<{32, 35, 36, 46, 64}>> would look like:

1|
2|
3|256
4|6
5|
6|4
7|
8|
9|

Notice that the <<leaves are organized from least to greatest!>>


Something to note is that Stem and Leaf plots are usually viewed along with a Legend that tells the reader the value of the stem and the leaves (thousands, hundreds, millions, etc.), but that will be omitted for this challenge.


Given a collection of natural numbers between {{10}} and {{99}} (inclusive), produce a stem and leaf plot with those values.
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> The natural numbers included in the plot, separated by spaces
data.outputDescription:
an ASCII stem and leaf plot comprised of all of the input values
the stem is the tens place and the leaves are the ones place for each value

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A Stem and Leaf plot is a type of table used to display a collection of data where every data point has the same number of digits.

Stem and leaf plots consists of two halves: a stem, and leaves sticking out from the stem.

The stems consist of the first few (usually one) highest-significance digits of a number.

The leaves extending from each stem represent the lowest significant digits for each data point in the collection.

A leaf can be recombined with the stem it belongs to in order to get back the value that leaf represents.



For this challenge, the stem will represent the 1st digit of the data points (the tens place), and the leaves will represent the 2nd digit of the data points (the ones place).

A Stem and Leaf plot for the values {32, 35, 36, 46, 64} would look like:

1|
2|
3|256
4|6
5|
6|4
7|
8|
9|

Notice that the leaves are organized from least to greatest!


Something to note is that Stem and Leaf plots are usually viewed along with a Legend that tells the reader the value of the stem and the leaves (thousands, hundreds, millions, etc.), but that will be omitted for this challenge.


Given a collection of natural numbers between 10 and 99 (inclusive), produce a stem and leaf plot with those values.
Input
Line 1: The natural numbers included in the plot, separated by spaces
Output
an ASCII stem and leaf plot comprised of all of the input values
the stem is the tens place and the leaves are the ones place for each value
Constraints
0 < number of values <= 500
10 <= each individual datapoint <= 99
Example
Input
33 29 58
Output
1|
2|9
3|3
4|
5|8
6|
7|
8|
9|
